intro: Bikinia breynei, commonly known as the Cape goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has silver-gray foliage with small, yellow-orange flowers. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its drought tolerance and attractive appearance. Bikinia breynei plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
